content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Mine at Position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0) with a drop position at (41.5, -80.5), connected to:
- Stone Furnace at position (41.0, -80.0)
- Wooden Chest at position (43.5, -79.5)

### Iron Plate Mine at Position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0) with a drop position at (-14.5, -48.5), connected to:
- Wooden Chest at position (-14.5, -48.5)

### Copper Furnace at Position (-20.0, -71.0)
- Stone Furnace at position (-20.0, -71.0) currently out of fuel and lacking ingredients to smelt.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors Due to Insufficient Inventory Items
- Ensure you have sufficient coal in your inventory before attempting to insert it into drills or furnaces. This will prevent errors like "Could not insert: No coal to insert from your inventory."

### Errors When Inserting Items
- Before inserting items into an entity, verify that the entity can accept the items. This will help avoid errors related to item insertion.

## NAMESPACE

### Utility Functions
- `insert_item`: A function used to insert items into entities. Ensure the item type and quantity are available in the inventory before calling this function.

### Important Variables
- `iron_furnace`: Represents the iron furnace entity.
- `copper_drill`: Represents the copper mining drill entity.

This report provides a summary of the existing structures, error tips for improving gameplay, and namespace details for better code management.
